name: Assassins: real world manifestations
description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

key_work.title: Assassins
key_work.creator_credit: Ryan White, Jessica Hargrave, Greenwich Entertainment and Tripod Media
key_work.brief_description: In the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, editing factual media has the ability to create doubt, shedding new light on closed cases and can even right the wrongs of the justice system.

constellations_primary.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_primary.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

constellations_primary.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_primary.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

start.title: Catfish
start.creator_credit: Ariel Schulman, Henry Joost, Andrew Jarecki, Marc Smerling, Hit the Ground Running Films and Supermarché
start.brief_description: Nev, a 24-year-old New York-based photographer, has no idea what he’s in for when Abby, an eight-year-old girl from rural Michigan, contacts him on Facebook, seeking permission to paint one of his photographs. When he receives her remarkable painting, Nev begins a friendship and correspondence with Abby’s family. But things really get interesting when he develops a cyber-romance with Abby’s attractive older sister, Megan, a musician and model. Prompted by some startling revelations about Megan, Nev and his buddies embark on a road trip in search of the truth.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

end.title: The Keepers
end.creator_credit: Ryan White, Film 45 and Tripod Media
end.brief_description: This docuseries examines the decades-old murder of Sister Catherine Cesnik and its suspected link to a priest accused of abuse.

For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

links.description: Not only did it coin a new phrase, Catfish the film became such a phenomenon it was adapted into a long-running MTV show of the same name, which is a documentary television series like The Keepers.

end.title: Visible: Out On Television
end.creator_credit: David Bender, David Permut, Apple Video Programming, LLC, Permut Presentations, Push It Productions and Tripod Media

video_links.name: Visible: Out on Television — Official Trailer | Apple TV+

end.brief_description: Explore the history of the LGBTQ movement through the lens of TV in this five-part docuseries. Combining archival footage with new interviews, it looks at homophobia, invisibility, the evolution of LGBTQ characters, and coming out in the TV industry.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: Netflix true-crime series The Keepers looked into the unsolved murder of a nun, who was the high school teacher of director Ryan White‘s aunt. He also helmed Visible: Out On Television about the importance of gay representation on TV.

start.title: Visible: Out On Television
start.creator_credit: David Bender, David Permut, Apple Video Programming, LLC, Permut Presentations, Push It Productions and Tripod Media

video_links.name: Visible: Out on Television — Official Trailer | Apple TV+

start.brief_description: Explore the history of the LGBTQ movement through the lens of TV in this five-part docuseries. Combining archival footage with new interviews, it looks at homophobia, invisibility, the evolution of LGBTQ characters, and coming out in the TV industry.

end.title: Hamilton
end.creator_credit: Thomas Kail, Paul Tazewell, Jeffrey Seller, Lin-Manuel Miranda, 5000 Broadway Productions, Nevis Productions, Old 320 Sycamore, RadicalMedia, The Public Theatre, Walt Disney Pictures and David Korins
end.brief_description: Presenting the tale of American founding father Alexander Hamilton, this filmed version of the original Broadway smash hit is the story of America then, told by America now.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: Visible: Out On Television featured interviews with several prominent LBGTQIA+ celebrities, including Jonathan Groff. Better known for his film and television work, Groff is also famous for originating the role of King George III in the stage production Hamilton.

start.title: Hamilton
start.creator_credit: Thomas Kail, Paul Tazewell, Jeffrey Seller, Lin-Manuel Miranda, 5000 Broadway Productions, Nevis Productions, Old 320 Sycamore, RadicalMedia, The Public Theatre, Walt Disney Pictures and David Korins
start.brief_description: Presenting the tale of American founding father Alexander Hamilton, this filmed version of the original Broadway smash hit is the story of America then, told by America now.

end.title: Mindhunter
end.creator_credit: Jennifer Starzyk, Jim Davidson, Liz Hannah, Denver and Delilah Productions, Jen X Productions, Inc., Panic Pictures / No. 13 and Steve Arnold
end.brief_description: An agent in the FBI’s Elite Serial Crime Unit develops profiling techniques as he pursues notorious serial killers and rapists.

constellations_other.name: Eric Bana
constellations_other.description: There must be something that draws Australian creatives like Eric Bana to darker material as they shoot to stardom overseas. Australia's penal colony past perhaps?

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: Considered one of the most complex recordings of a live, Broadway musical, Hamilton was released as the jewel in Disney+’s crown. Cast member Groff experienced success on another streaming service with David Fincher’s Netflix drama Mindhunter.

start.title: Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer
start.creator_credit: Trish Wood, Betty Orr, Michael Kot, Amazon Studios and Saloon Media

video_links.name: Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer Official Trailer | Prime Video

start.brief_description: After years of silence, Ted Bundy’s long-term girlfriend Elizabeth Kendall, her daughter Molly, and other survivors come forward for the first time in a docuseries that reframes Bundy’s crimes from a female perspective. The series reveals how Bundy’s pathological hatred of women collided with the culture wars and the feminist movement of the 1970s in one of the most infamous crime stories of our time.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

end.title: I'll Be Gone in the Dark
end.creator_credit: Elizabeth Wolff, Kate Barry, HBO Documentary Films, Story Syndicate, Amber Unkle and Susan Alegria

video_links.name: I'll Be Gone In the Dark (2020): Official Trailer | HBO

end.brief_description: An exploration of the case of the Golden State Killer who terrorized California in the 1970s and 1980s, committing 50 sexual assaults and 10 murders, and true crime author Michelle McNamara’s obsessive quest to find justice on behalf of his victims.

constellations_other.name: Reasonable doubt
constellations_other.description: Factual media has the power to reframe information and put forth new, persuasive arguments.  For the criminal justice system, where convictions are made based on arguments being convincing beyond a reasonable doubt, True Crime media has the ability to create doubt, right the wrongs of the justice system, and shed new light on closed cases.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: Directed by Trish Wood, Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer reclaimed the narrative by hearing directly from his many female victims and survivors. Through the story of Michelle McNamara, I’ll Be Gone In The Dark attempted to do the same.

end.brief_description: Nev, a 24-year-old New York-based photographer, has no idea what he’s in for when Abby, an eight-year-old girl from rural Michigan, contacts him on Facebook, seeking permission to paint one of his photographs. When he receives her remarkable painting, Nev begins a friendship and correspondence with Abby’s family. constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: At the heart of the murder plot documented in Assassins are two women – aspiring actresses Siti Aisyah and Doan Thi Huong – who are duped into performing the assassination. Fellow documentary feature Catfish also deals with identity distortion.

The series reveals how Bundy’s pathological hatred of women collided with the culture wars and the feminist movement of the 1970s in one of the most infamous crime stories of our time.

constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: Mindhunter was based on the true story of the FBI’s Behavioural Sciences Unit, which was set up to investigate serial predators like Ted Bundy, who was the subject of documentary Ted Bundy: Falling for a Killer.

end.title: What Happened, Miss Simone?
end.creator_credit: Liz Garbus, Rebecca Luke, Amy Hobby, Justin Wilkes, RadicalMedia and Markus Kirschner
end.brief_description: The film chronicles Nina Simone’s journey from child piano prodigy to iconic musician and passionate activist, told in her own words.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

links.description: While hunting the Golden State Killer, filmmaker Liz Garbus set out to reframe true crime stories – which often depict women as victims – with a female lens in I’ll Be Gone In The Dark. She also directed What Happened, Miss Simone?
